questions.prompt: 1. In BG 8.1, Arjuna asks Krishna about the meaning of Brahman, karma, and which two other important concepts?
questions.feedback: Arjuna inquires about Brahman, karma, adhyatma (individual self), and adhibhuta (physical manifestation).

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 8.2, what does Krishna say is the individual self (adhyatma)?
choices: The consciousness residing in the body
questions.feedback: Krishna explains adhyatma as the individual consciousness in the body.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 8.3, what does Krishna say changes at the time of death?
choices: The body; the soul transmigrates to a new body
questions.feedback: At death, the soul leaves the old body and takes on a new one.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 8.4, what is the supreme controller of all existence called?
questions.feedback: Adhiyajna refers to the Supreme Controller who is Krishna Himself.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 8.5, what should be meditated upon and remembered at the time of death?
choices: Krishna; whoever remembers Him attains His abode
questions.feedback: One who meditates on Krishna at death achieves His transcendental abode.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 8.6, how is the next birth determined according to Krishna?
choices: By what one constantly thinks of during life; the mind makes the man
questions.feedback: Whatever one thinks of during life, one attains at death.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 8.7, what should one do to be always absorbed in Krishna consciousness?
choices: Remember Krishna and fight as duty without deviation
questions.feedback: One should meditate on Krishna and engage in all activities without deviation.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 8.8, what is the result of practicing meditation on Krishna throughout life?
choices: Being able to remember Krishna at the time of death
questions.feedback: Constant meditation on Krishna ensures one's memory of Him at death.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 8.9, what is the nature of the Supreme Lord regarding knowledge?
choices: He is ancient and the knower of everything, infinitely powerful and omniscient
questions.feedback: Krishna is the eternal knower, all-pervading, the ultimate controller, and infinitely powerful.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 8.11, how can one transcend the material world according to Krishna?
choices: By meditating on Krishna with a one-pointed mind
questions.feedback: Through constant meditation on Krishna, one can transcend the material world.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 8.12, what do the yogis reach when they withdraw the senses from sense objects?
questions.feedback: Yogis who withdraw the senses and meditate attain the Supreme Brahman.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 8.13, what is the path to the supreme abode described as?
choices: The narrow way of Krishna consciousness
questions.feedback: The path to the supreme abode is narrow and can be achieved through strict meditation.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 8.14, how should one approach Krishna according to this verse?
questions.feedback: Those who always remember Krishna with single-minded devotion attain Him easily.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 8.15, what is the destination of those who attain the highest perfection?
choices: They come back to this world
They attain the supreme abode and do not return
questions.feedback: Those who attain Krishna's supreme abode never return to this material world.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 8.16, what is said about the duration of life in the highest planets?
choices: Even in the highest planets, life is temporary; only Krishna consciousness leads to eternity
questions.feedback: Even the duration of life in the highest planets is temporary; only attainment of Krishna is permanent.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 8.17, how long is one day of Brahma?
choices: One thousand ages of the demigods
questions.feedback: One day of Brahma equals a thousand ages of the demigods; all material life is temporary.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 8.19, what happens to all beings at the time of creation and dissolution?
choices: They are created at one time and dissolved at another; only Krishna is eternal
questions.feedback: All material manifestations are created and destroyed; only Krishna's kingdom is eternal.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 8.20-21, what is beyond the material manifestation?
choices: An unmanifested eternity; the supreme abode of Krishna
questions.feedback: Beyond the material manifestation is Krishna's eternal supreme abode.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 8.22, how can one achieve the supreme abode that is beyond the cycles of creation and destruction?
choices: Through devotional service; by rendering service to Krishna with love
questions.feedback: Only through devotional service and love for Krishna can one reach His eternal abode.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 8.23-25, what are the two paths mentioned for the soul after leaving the body?
choices: Light and darkness; the path of light leads to Krishna's abode
questions.feedback: Those who depart in darkness go to repeated birth; those in light attain Krishna's abode.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 8.26, what is the only way to reach Krishna's supreme abode?
choices: Through understanding Krishna's true nature and constant remembrance of Him
questions.feedback: One must understand Krishna's supremacy and engage in His loving devotional service.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 8.27 (purport), what is the essence of Krishna's teachings in this chapter?
choices: Remember Krishna and attain His eternal abode; He is the goal of all activities
questions.feedback: Chapter 8's essence is that constant remembrance of Krishna leads to eternal life with Him.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 8.3 (from purport), why is understanding the soul's transmigration important?
choices: To inspire detachment from material life and focus on Krishna
questions.feedback: Understanding rebirth motivates one to achieve liberation through Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 8.7 (from purport), what is the yoga of constant remembrance?
choices: Remembering Krishna in all activities, maintaining one-pointed devotion
questions.feedback: The yoga of remembrance means thinking of Krishna continuously during all daily activities.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 8 (summary), what is the main purpose of this chapter's teachings?
choices: Teaching how to achieve Krishna's eternal abode through remembrance and devotion
questions.feedback: Chapter 8 teaches that constant remembrance of Krishna at death and throughout life leads to His eternal abode.
